result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick T Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Terminate early at 18 mo if no ATR's, no new charges to probable cause and Agent's recommendation. If revoked on both cases, would get 55 days for a total of 66.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.   Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any business where primary sale is alcohol.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
